titleStmt.title: A letter of Lieutenant Colonel John Lilburns, written to Mr. John Price of Colemanstreet London, (and a member of Mr. John Goodwins congregation) the 31. of March 1651. about the harsh and unequal dealing that his unckle Mr. George Lilburn, and several others of his family findes from the hands of Sir Arthur Haslerig. Unto which is annexed Mr. John Price his answer thereunto.
titleStmt.author: Lilburne, John, 1614?-1657.

titleStmt.title: A letter of Lieutenant Colonel John Lilburns, written to Mr. John Price of Colemanstreet London, (and a member of Mr. John Goodwins congregation) the 31. of March 1651. about the harsh and unequal dealing that his unckle Mr. George Lilburn, and several others of his family findes from the hands of Sir Arthur Haslerig. Unto which is annexed Mr. John Price his answer thereunto.
titleStmt.author: Lilburne, John, 1614?-1657.
Price, John, Citizen of London.

notesStmt.note: Includes a letter on page 7 dated and signed: April 3. 1651. John Price.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
